basic_password.description: Corresponding password for basic_username. Can be set with the `RODE_BASIC_PASSWORD` environment variable.

basic_username.description: The username configured in the Rode instance for basic auth. Cannot be configured alongside any of the OIDC options. Can be set with the `RODE_BASIC_USERNAME` environment variable.

disable_transport_security.description: Disables transport security for the gRPC connection to Rode. Can also be set with the `RODE_DISABLE_TRANSPORT_SECURITY` environment variable.

host.description: Host and port of the Rode instance. Can also be specified by setting the `RODE_HOST` environment variable.

lazy_init.description: Defers instantiation of the Rode client until the first time the provider is used. This can be useful when provider config depends on other resources being applied.

oidc_client_id.description: OIDC/OAuth2 client id that is permitted the client credentials grant. Can be set with the `RODE_OIDC_CLIENT_ID` environment variable.

oidc_client_secret.description: Corresponding client secret for oidc_client_id. Can be set with the `RODE_OIDC_CLIENT_SECRET` environment variable.

oidc_scopes.description: A space-delimited list of scopes to request in the client credentials grant. Can also be set with the `RODE_OIDC_SCOPES` environment variable.

oidc_tls_insecure_skip_verify.description: Disable transport security when communicating with the OAuth2 server. Only recommended for local development. Set with the `RODE_OIDC_TLS_INSECURE_SKIP_VERIFY` environment variable.

oidc_token_url.description: OAuth2 token url. Can be set with the OIDC_TOKEN_URL environment variable

deleted.description: Indicates that the policy has been deleted.

description.description: A brief summary of the policy

message.description: A summary of changes since the last version

block.description: An Open Policy Agent Rego policy.

policy_group.description: Name of the policy group to associate with the policy

policy_version_id.description: Unique identifier of the versioned policy

block.description: A policy assignment is a mapping between a policy group and a policy version

deleted.description: Indicates that the policy group has been deleted.

description.description: A brief summary of the intended use of the policy group

name.description: Unique identifier for the policy group

block.description: A policy group is a collection of policies that Rode evaluates against a resource.
